alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 7:04PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wake and Franklin Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bunn, or 8 miles southwest of Louisburg. This storm was nearly stationary. Radar estimates as much as 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen in areas south of Louisburg. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain will cause ponding on roadways. Locations impacted include... Louisburg, Wake Forest, Zebulon, Franklinton, Bunn, Rolesville, Youngsville, Pilot and Purnell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
